intro: Lastrea vellea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, long-lasting flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with indirect sunlight. Its leaves are glossy and velvety, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, white, and red. Lastrea vellea is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
